Complexity from Constraints — LLM Usage Statement (LLMS)
=======================================================

Purpose
  This document states how Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI systems may interact with this repository.
  It is intended to be clear, humble, and easy to honor.

Allowed
  - Inspecting, indexing, summarizing, and reasoning over this repository for human users.
  - Generating snippets or examples that cite this repository with clear attribution.
  - Evaluation, benchmarking, and non-persistent embeddings for search.

Restricted
  - Training foundation or general-purpose AI models on the code or documentation in this repository
    without explicit permission from the maintainers.
  - Building derivative training datasets that include substantial portions of this repository.
  - Shipping weights whose primary learning signal is this repository’s content.

Attribution
  Please preserve our project name (“Complexity from Constraints” by Oscar Goldman) and link back to the source when referencing.

If in doubt
  If your use is not clearly covered by “Allowed”, please seek permission first.
  You can open a discussion or contact the maintainers as appropriate for your distribution channel.

Notes for AI crawlers
  We understand emerging efforts (e.g., ai.txt, robots policies). If your crawler supports such signals,
  please interpret this LLMS.txt as: allow=browse,summarize; disallow=train,derivative-datasets,weight-updates-from-content.

License
  See the project’s LICENSE once finalized. This LLMS statement supplements, and does not replace, the license.
